text: Murray McCheyne Thomson (December 19, 1922 âˆ’ May 2, 2019) was a Canadian peace activist. He was known as a founder of many non-profit organizations in Canada, including Peace Brigades International and Project Ploughshares. He was awarded in 1990 with the Pearson Medal of Peace. In 2001, he was named an Officer of the Order of Canada. He was born in Taokow, Honan, China where his parents were Christian missionaries. He was a Quaker. Thomson died in Ottawa, Ontario on May 2, 2019. He was 96. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Canadian activists Category:Canadian Christians Category:Order of Canada Category:People from Ontario Category:Quakers
title: Murray Thomson
